title: Latest live updates from Shropshire on Friday 19 August 2016 - BBC News
summary: wet weather greets thousands attending the v festival .
liverpool man appears in court charged with meole brace murder .
family of missing farmer 'overwhelmed ' by offers of help with harvest .
shropshire wildlife trust given £ 1m to teach conservation skills to young people .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening .

documents.title: weather : a dry night ahead , but more rain to come
text: we 're forecast a dry end to the day , but there is more rain to come tomorrow .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: football : telford striker wants ruthless streak
text: afc telford striker dave hibbert says the bucks need to be ruthless in their efforts to turn decent performances into victories .
they got their first win of the season against stalybridge on tuesday and travel to curzon ashton tomorrow .
but having still only taken four points form their opening four games , there is room for improvement .
it 's about being more ruthless at the back as well as in front of goal . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: soldier and his brother sentenced for wellington street brawl
text: two brothers - one of whom is a serving soldier - were involved in a brawl outside a pub which left three people injured .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : ice baby survives and soggy start to v festival
text: on midlands today this evening - we 've got a great story of a baby girl whose heart stopped beating for eight minutes , who has made a full recovery after being `` frozen '' for three days .
we 'll also be at what 's proved to be a soggy start to v festival in staffordshire as thousands of people turned up in wet and windy conditions .
both those stories and much more from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: travel : slow moving traffic remains around weston park
text: the traffic around weston park looks better this evening than it did first thing this morning , but with more people still arriving for the v festival , it 's not over yet .
and there is still a warning of slow-moving traffic on the a41 , near tong .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: v festival : rhianna and justin bieber headlining
text: this weekend 's v festival at weston park will be headlined by rhianna on saturday and justin bieber on sunday .
bieber has already said he 's planning the `` biggest stage production '' in v 's 21-year history - one part will see 800 gallons of purified , 40c water soak the star at the front of the stage .
the mind boggles .

other performers this weekend who will perform at both the festival 's weston park site and hylands park , chelmsford include jess glynne , little mix , david guetta , kaiser chiefs , travis , rita ora and faithless .
author: BBC Newsbeat

documents.title: wildlife trust gets £ 1m to teach young people about conservation
text: shropshire wildlife trust is getting £ 1m from a national lottery fund to pay for projects designed to teach young people about the environment and help them get jobs in the field .

it is one of 31 schemes around the country to get one of these grants and young people in the county will be encouraged to get involved in conservation work , starting in the oswestry and ellesmere areas next month .
the courses will teach skills such as hedge-laying , wildlife identification and how to clear plants out of ponds .

documents.title: headlines : thousands arrive for v festival ; man in court over murder ; wildlife trust gets £ 1m to teach skills
text: our headlines this evening :
- thousands arrive for v festival at weston park
- man appears in court charged with meole brace murder
- shropshire wildlife trust gets £ 1m to teach conservation skills
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: american football : shropshire revolution in play-off action
text: shropshire revolution travel to yorkshire to face the leeds bobcats in the playoffs this weekend .
it 's only the fourth time they 've made it into the post-season and after the disappointment of last season 's relegation it 's a chance to prove a point .
their opponents narrowly beat the chester romans to the nfc ii title , finishing with a 9-1 record , so the revolution will know they 're in for a tough game .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: met office warns of high winds tomorrow
text: the met office is warning of `` unseasonably strong winds '' and blustery showers tomorrow .
it says there could be gusts of up to 50 mph ( 80kph ) and possible disruption to traffic and outdoor activities .
hope all those tents at the v festival are well-secured .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire 's entry in robot wars packs a punch
text: shropshire 's entry in the new series of robot wars carries a weapon which claims to pack more power than a sniper 's bullet .
pulsar has been built by ellis ware and his parents , peter and tara , and is armoured with 8mm ( 0.3 inch ) thick steel plates .
its main weapon is a flywheel which spins at 9000rpm ( 220mph ) and can toss opponents into the air .
it also contains parts produced on a 3d printer .

documents.title: watch : v festival organiser confident of putting on a show
text: it 's been a damp start to the v festival weekend and more rain is forecast for tomorrow , but the organisers are in a confident mood .
author: Nicola Beckford
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: footballer : lee fowler leaves afc telford united
text: lee fowler has left afc telford united after he and the club agreed to cancel his contract .
fowler was substituted at tamworth last week and criticised by manager rob smith .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: v festival weather forecast from met office
text: for everyone heading to or already at v festival at weston park this weekend , the met office have come up with a local forecast for the site .
( whisper - it 's not going to rain all the time ) .
we 've got a forecast for @ twitterid at weston park here it 's going to be quite windy at times , with some rain too .

documents.title: shropshire mangel-wurzel experiment producing results
text: our experiment to try to grow mangel-wurzels is going well .
they were a fashionable crop in the 17th and 18th centuries , but are rarely seen on a commercial scale these days .
we 've been growing them with the help of ellesmere farmer stephen jones and this is what they looked like in june .
and when i went to see them today , they were looking a lot bigger .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: travel : crash on m6
text: two lanes are closed on the m6 northbound between j10 and j10a after a crash near the m54 turn-off .
not great news , particularly with v festival traffic on the road .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: v festival : people not being put off by wet weather
text: people arriving at stafford railway station who are heading to weston park for this weekend 's v festival say the wet weather 's not put them off .
the forecast for the weekend at the site includes rain and showers .
thousands are expected for the event which will be headlined by rihanna and justin bieber .
author: John Acres
BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: rio : mysterious trophies , bikini wax ban and diving over the line
text: if you 're anything like me , you 're already looking forward to this weekend 's olym especially those events involving local competitors such as birchfield harrier matthew hudson-smith who is due to run in the men 's 4x400m team relay on saturday .
then there 's a pair of west midlanders for team gb 's women 's hockey squad - who battle it out for gold in tonight 's final .
but what about the lesser-spotted oddities of the games ?
news takes a look at the quirkier side of competition , from `` bored-looking '' lifeguards overseeing green pools to a ban on `` toilet fishing '' .
and if that 's not enough , take a look at the headline above- talk about a close shave , or not , as the case may be .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : man in court over meole brace murder ; police biker hurt ; stormy weather warning
text: here 's a recap of our top stories this afternoon :
- liverpool man appears in court charged with meole brace murder
- police biker hurt in crash near v festival
- weekend weather warning
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: man appears in court on murder charge
text: a liverpool man is scheduled to appear before shrewsbury crown court on monday , charged with the murder of michael warham in meole brace at the start of the month .
declan graves , who is 19 , made an appearance before telford magistrates this morning and will be held in custody until this next appearance .

documents.title: watch : wet and muddy welcome to v festival
text: it 's august , it 's not particularly warm , it 's wet and it 's muddy - welcome to v festival at weston park .
the three-day event at weston park is the biggest in the west midlands and attracts tens-of-thousands of visitors .
roads around the site have been getting busy since early this morning .
author: Nicola Beckford
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: missing farmer plea : 'not knowing is killing us '
text: the family of a farmer missing for two months have said they have been `` overwhelmed '' by the generosity of the public .
andrew green , 33 , was last seen driving away from yew tree farm in chorley , shropshire , on 22 june .
his distraught parents , edward and julie , who appealed for help to find him , have since received offers via social media to help bring in the harvest .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police biker hurt in crash near v festival
text: a police officer 's been taken to hospital after their marked motorbike collided with a car near the v festival at weston park today .
staffordshire police say it was around 09:00 on watling street and both officer and the woman driving the fiat 500 were treated by paramedics .
the force says their injuries are n't thought to be serious and an investigation 's now under way into what happened .
author: Tim Wedgwood
BBC Local LIve

documents.title: large barn fire at alveley
text: firefighters were out last night , dealing with a fire in a barn near alveley which contained around 500 tonnes of straw .
it took them just over an hour to put out and they are still there this morning , making sure it 's safe .

documents.title: barrow sign shrewsbury 's smith on loan
text: barrow sign shrewsbury 's smith on loan

documents.title: travel : exit closed for v festival
text: a reminder if you 're on the roads this afternoon .
other arrangements are in place on the m54 and a41 today .
please note that as part of our plan to keep traffic moving for # vfestival & ensure road users safety we have clsd the # m6 n/b exit at j12 .

documents.title: some items stolen from police recovered , but not all
text: some of the items stolen from police forces in the west midlands have been recovered over the past five years .
when thieves made off with a blue flashing lamp , officers in warwickshire managed to get it back .
but cops in our region have n't always been so lucky .
when four horses were pinched from west mercia police the thieves got away scot-free .
whether items were retrieved or not , some people are already asking whether the boys and girls in blue need to be a little more careful with their own property .
author: Tom Turrell
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : stealing off the police
text: handcuffs , emergency vehicles and more than a £ 100,000 in cash - all items stolen from the police in our region in the last few years .
the figures were released as part of a freedom of information request and the items were taken from both individual officers on the beat and police stations .
we 'll have a fuller look at what 's been taken , from which force and reaction to the news , on midlands today from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Tom Turrell
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: weather warning for the midlands
text: an early yellow weather warning for wind has been issued for saturday .
the met office says there may be gusts of 40-45mph which have the potential to cause disruption to travel and outdoor activities .
a yellow severe weather warning for # wind has been updated : stay # weatheraware @ twitterid
the warning is only for tomorrow .
^eric
always pay for having a bit of sunshine
wo n't be much fun on the beach at # bournemouthairshow
make it stop raining !
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: festival-goers reminded to pack their boots
text: with the wet weather expected to remain tomorrow , here 's a reminder from the police .
going to @ twitterid ?
bring your welly boots

documents.title: items stolen from police : 'how on earth could all this property go missing ? '
text: nine bikes from the west midlands force , a sat nav in west merica and a lap top in staffordshire are among the items stolen from police across the region .
they are bound to raise an eyebrow among many .
their value ranges from a few pounds to tens of thousands of pounds .
`` but , '' i hear you ask , `` how on earth could all this property go missing from under the noses of officers ? ''
in the case of the £ 113,000 stolen from within the bowels of the warwickshire force hq , the answer is , despite a court hearing , nobody knows .
you can see more on this story on midlands today , bbc one , at 13:30 and 18:30 .
author: Tom Turrell
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: headlines : man charged with meole brace murder ; offer of help for missing man 's family ; v festival starts
text: these are our headlines this lunchtime :
- liverpool man charged with meole brace murder
- family of missing farmer offered help to bring in the harvest
- thousands arrive at weston park for v festival
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: murder charge over teen stab death
text: murder charge over teen stab death

documents.title: v festival 'low on crime ' say police
text: this weekend 's v festival at weston park should be low on crime , according to police .
over 90,000 people are expected at the event over the weekend and staffordshire police say they will have uniformed and plain-clothed officers on site during the event .
it is rare at the v festival - we do get some tents broken into , not very many at all , and we do get some vehicles broken into .
if you come to the festival , your chances of becoming a victim of crime are very slim . ''
author: Alice Bentley
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: football : no panic from shrewsbury midfielder
text: shrewsbury town have only up one point out of nine in their opening three league fixtures and are yet to score a goal - but midfielder ian black is n't panicking .
he believes that once the first goal is scored , more will come and that there is enough quality in the squad .
shrewsbury play chesterfield this weekend .
people will be questioning the strikers , but we 've created the opportunities , it 's just finding that edge to slot it in . ''

documents.title: madeley family battling it out on robot wars this weekend
text: a family from madeley will be appearing on this sunday 's episode of robot wars , on bbc two
ellis ware designed and built pulsar in nine weeks with the help of his parents .
ellis is entirely self-taught in the art of engineering , which he learned from watching online tutorials .
author: James Fanning
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : wet weather likely to remain throughout the day
text: there 's not going to be much let-up in the wet weather today , although it might clear for a while late in the evening .
and bad news for everyone at v festival this weekend - the rain will continue on saturday .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : police advise motorists to avoid weston park area
text: if you 're not travelling to the v festival this morning , the police are advising you to avoid the weston park area , because the traffic remains slow there .
both the a5 and the a41 are busy , heading into the site .
traffic : if you are not heading for @ twitterid please avoid a5 near # weston park as delays are building for local traffic
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: harvest help for missing farmer 's family
text: harvest help for missing farmer 's family

documents.title: breakingman charged with shrewsbury murder
text: a 19-year-old man from liverpool has been charged with murdering michael warham in meole brace , shrewsbury , earlier this month .
declan graves , from dymchurch road , has been remanded in custody until his appearance in telford magistrates ' court today .
mr warham , also from liverpool , was found with a stab wound on wayford drive on the evening of monday 1 august and died in hospital three days later .

documents.title: olym shropshire high jumper has tokyo ambitions
text: shropshire high jumper beth partridge missed out on the rio olym by 6cm , but at 26 she still has hopes of competing at tokyo in 2020 .
she took up the sport when she was just seven years old and with the top high jumpers competing well into their 30s , time is still on her side .
she said that failing to qualify for these games `` makes me want to try more '' and despite missing out , she claimed the english high jump title a couple of weeks ago .
author: Eric and Clare's Breakfast Show

documents.title: vehicles and horses stolen from police
text: emergency vehicles , dustbins , horses , a barbeque and garden gates are just a few of the items to be stolen from west mercia police .
the items were all taken from officers on the beat or from police stations , according to data obtained by a bbc freedom of information request .
in all , police forces in the west midlands had more than £ 100,000 in cash stolen in the last five years .
items stolen from other forces in the region include cannabis plants , handcuffs and laptops .

documents.title: travel : heavy traffic around weston park
text: the v festival is continuing to cause hold-ups this morning .
it 's slow-going heading into weston park along the a5 or the a41 and the police are reminding you to follow road-signs if you are heading into the festival .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: headlines : atkinson police officers investigated ; v festival starts ; telford family in robot wars
text: our top stories this morning :
- two police officers under criminal investigations over dalian atkinson death
- traffic slow around weston park as v festival gets under way
- telford family take part in robot wars
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: rain causes chaos on shropshire roads
text: a series of crashes on the shropshire 's roads is causing traffic misery for motorists during the morning rush hour .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: v festival : rain arriving already
text: west midlands ambulance service say it 's already looking `` a little wet '' at weston park with v festival set to get under way later .
it 's looking a little wet at weston park for those arriving at v festival this morning .
do n't forget the wellies !
no so sunny this morning
hope u packed ur wet gear

documents.title: travel : congestion and closures due to v festival
text: if you 're heading to the v festival at weston park , we 've already got traffic issues on routes near the site :
- the m6 exit slip road at junction 12 for gailey is closed northbound due to the event .
- there 's slow traffic on the a5 westbound between gailey island , gailey and the a41 in weston-under-lizard .
- it 's also slow going on the a41 northbound in tong at the offoxey road junction because of people heading to v festival .
staffordshire police is urging drivers not use sat-navs on their journey to the venue but follow road signs .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: headlines : footballer death family welcome investigation ; thousands expected at v festival ; madeley family joins robot wars
text: here are the stories we are looking at this morning :
- the family of former footballer dalian atkinson who died after being tasered welcomes news that two officers are under criminal investigation
- thousands of visitors are expected at v festival at weston park
- a family from madeley will be competing on bbc two 's robot wars on sunday
author: James Fanning
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: dalian atkinson : family 'determined to get justice '
text: the family of former aston villa striker dalian atkinson who died after being tasered by police has welcomed news that two officers are under criminal investigation .
the development was confirmed yesterday evening by the independent police complaints commission which has been examining the circumstances surrounding mr atkinson 's death .
he was pronounced dead at hospital on monday morning following the incident in a street near telford .
in a statement released through the charity inquest , his family said it was still in shock and `` determined to get justice '' .
we are looking to the ipcc to carry out a thorough and robust investigation that will ultimately provide transparency and accountability .
dalian 's memory requires nothing less . ''

documents.title: thousands due at 21st v festival
text: thousands of visitors are expected at weston park this weekend for the 21st v festival .
held in the grounds of the stately home it 's the biggest festival in the midlands and will feature justin bieber , rihanna and travis .
people are being advised to leave plenty of time for their journey as traffic is expected to be extremely busy around junction three of the m54 and the surrounding area .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: a few problems on the roads this morning
text: there 's been an accident on stable road ackleton - the b4176 is closed in both directions .
the a41 is closed between albrighton and the a5 junction , because of v festival traffic .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: it 'll remain wet and breezy for much of the day with rain slowly clearing later inthe afternoon .
highs of 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning - welcome to our live updates
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid message via facebook .

documents.title: woman admits beheading pet snakes
text: woman admits beheading pet snakes

documents.title: officers probed over footballer death
text: officers probed over footballer death

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: breakingpolice officers face investigation over footballer dalian atkinson death
text: two police officers are facing a criminal investigation in the wake of former footballer dalian atkinson 's death after being tasered outside his childhood home in telford in the early hours of monday .
atkinson went into cardiac arrest on his way to hospital , where he was pronounced dead .

the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) said the two officers had also been served with gross misconduct notices and the investigation would focus on the `` level and type of force used '' .
a post-mortem test was carried out on the former aston villa , ipswich town and sheffield wednesday striker yesterday .
the cause of death was inconclusive and further tests are expected to be carried out .
the ipcc said its investigation was at a very early stage and urged people not to speculate .
we will keep mr atkinson 's family updated , and our thoughts remain with all of those affected by his death . ''

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : a day of a-level emotions
text: today , the waiting was finally over for thousands of a-level students and their families across the west midlands , who learned their results .
overall the pass rate for the region was slightly down on last year , although 97.9 % of students still passed with an a to e grade .
we 'll be looking at the help now being given to students through clearing at universities and how it 's been an emotional day for so many , on midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Nick Owen
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: more photos from shropshire-based raf photographer of the year
text: here are some more of ian forshaw 's superb photos - part of a collection which won him the raf photographer of the year prize .
he 's based at raf shawbury and is in with a shot of winning the people 's choice award too .
you can register your votes online .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : mellon in no rush for more shrewsbury signings
text: shrewsbury manager micky mellon says he is in no rush to sign more players , after bringing in 12 new faces over the summer .
he said he has a good mix in the squad now , with strong characters , lots of ambition and hunger to improve .
mellon has also pointed towards the youth in the squad and the flexibility he has to change the formation of the team , during a match if necessary .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: safety fears for children entering derelict telford flats
text: safety concerns have been raised after children were spotted entering an abandoned block of flats in telford .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: money to restore telford town park gardens
text: a number of gardens in telford , including fountains and a waterfall , will be smartened up with the help of a £ 49,440 grant .
telford and wrekin council says the money from the suez communities trust will be spent on the chelsea and the maxell cherry gardens .

the chelsea gardens are a series of gardens exhibited at the chelsea flower show between 1976-1979 and the maxell cherry garden is a japanese garden featuring cherry trees designed around a water cascade and a carp pool .
this work is something that we have campaigned for over a period of time and i am very pleased that the council has attracted this funding to carry out the work . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : woman sentenced for beheading snakes ; fish rescued from river ; raf award for shawbury photographer
text: our top stories this evening :
- market drayton woman given suspended sentence for beheading snakes
- over 100 fish rescued from dried-up river teme
- raf award for shawbury photographer
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fish rescued from dried-up river teme
text: part of the river teme has become so dry the environment agency has had to rescue over 100 salmon and more than 25 trout .
the fish have been moved downstream , beyond the point where the teme merges with the river clun .
a similar operation , to rescue more than 100 fish , took place last month .

documents.title: market drayton woman also drowned hamster
text: telford magistrates ' court has heard that weeks before cutting the heads off her pet snakes , 28-year-old jennifer lampe from market drayton drowned her hamster in a fish tank .

rspca prosecutor roger price told court she then `` put the dead hamster in a chest freezer '' and on another occasion she had admitted putting an unwanted cat in a carrier bag , taking it on a `` long bus ride '' and then releasing the animal .
she had successfully disposed of a second cat which she `` dumped behind a fence '' .

documents.title: v festival : medics prepare for 'one of biggest first aid operation of the year '
text: ambulances , 4x4 vehicles and 200 staff and volunteers are going to be sent to this year 's v festival in staffordshire , the ambulance service says .
west midlands ambulance service says early indications are for a mixed weekend of weather so it 's preparing for all conditions .
it says at last year 's event , medics treated just over 1,000 patients with 36 being taken to hospital .
the charity st john ambulance says it will also have staff on-site and describe it as `` one of the biggest first aid operations of the year '' .
author: Sarah Robertson
Producer, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: woman avoids jail after chopping heads off pet snakes
text: a market drayton woman who admitted chopping the heads off her pet snakes using scissors and a kitchen knife has been given a four-month suspended sentence by telford magistrates .
jennifer lampe was found by police with her reptiles ' severed heads in her pockets after drinking seven cans of lager and shots of amaretto .
she has also been banned from keeping animals for five years .
the 28-year-old said she feared she was about to be made homeless and would be unable to look after the boa constrictor and bull python .

documents.title: watch : calves learn to feed at burcote rearing facility
text: this week we have chosen burcote as the bbc radio shropshire place of the week and we 've been to visit a cattle-rearing facility there , run by the breakwell family .
there are over 120 young calves in the barn we were shown , learning to drink from mechanical milk-feeders .
in another barn there was a similar number of older calves .
author: Adam & Vicki Show

documents.title: concern over gha directors involvement in new service bid
text: concerns have been raised that two brothers who ran the collapsed coach firm gha have bid to run some of its abandoned routes - under a different company .
the ruabon-based company gha went into administration in july with the loss of 320 jobs after failing to pay a tax bill .

now it has been revealed gha 's former directors , arwyn lloyd davies and his brother gareth , are registered as directors with two companies which have won contracts from wrexham council - rj 's of wem limited and rml2418 ltd .
the bbc has attempted to contact the davies brothers for comment .
i would hope that wrexham council has done its due diligence checks to ensure that this new company wo n't go the same way as gha coaches and leave staff and passengers in the lurch once again . ''

documents.title: around 200 medical staff at weston park
text: last year over 1,000 patients were treated for a variety of injuries at the v festival at weston park , with 36 taken to hospital .
this year there will be around 200 medical staff on the site , including some from st john ambulance , as well as the west midlands ambulance service .
@ twitterid and @ twitterid getting their accommodation sorted ready for work at v festival !
living the high life i see

documents.title: headlines : a-level results day ; railway share offer ; raf photographer wins prize
text: here 's a look at our top stories this afternoon :
- thousands of shropshire students receive a-level results
- severn valley railway to sell shares to fund bridgnorth station revamp
- raf shawbury man wins top air force photography award
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: three face court after shropshire roof death
text: three people have appeared in court on charges relating to the death of a man electrocuted while working on the roof of a new barn in shropshire .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: a-level students 'no longer in limbo '
text: the students i spoke to at new college in wellington this morning seemed pleased with their a-level results .
and there was relief too , after all the waiting , with thomas billington telling me `` i feel like i 've just come out of a limbo state '' .
he and amber mansell have both won places at southampton university and she said : `` i was just shaking the whole morning , i did n't know what to do . ''

the vice-principal responsible for the curriculum , jean wright , said that she 'd noticed more students getting unconditional offers from universities this year , possibly because they were keen to fill spaces .
but she also said there 'd been a lot of interest from students in apprenticeships .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: travel : lane closed on m54
text: one lane 's closed on the m54 westbounds between j2 for wolverhampton and j3 for albrighton , due to a broken-down vehicle .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: shawbury man wins raf photographer of the year award
text: raf shawbury 's professional photographer has won the raf photographer of the year award .
ian forshaw has worked at the base since 1986 and was sent out on over 600 assignments last year .
he submitted nine photos to the judges , including this one of a firefighter extinguishing flames on a shawbury training simulator .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : joy or despair on a-level results day
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , the university admissions service ucas says a record number of students have been offered places on courses .
it comes as thousands of teenagers across the west midlands receive their a-level results .
the number of offers are up by 3 % compared with last year - we 'll have more from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: Elizabeth Glinka
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: universities busy with clearing
text: harper adams university and university centre shrewsbury are both running clearing operations today to help match students to courses , now a-level results are in .
join the largest industry in the world # food # farming # environment @ twitterid # alevelresults # clearing
our clearing hotline is open until 7:30pm today : give us a call on 08081642710 !
# alevelresults # clearing # shrewsbury

documents.title: afc telford : jack rea set to miss next match
text: jack rea looks likely to miss at least the next game for afc telford united after his comeback in tuesday 's win over stalybridge was cut short after just 12 minutes .
telford 's manager rob smith says it 's a blow , but other signs are better .
jack 's got to be rated as doubtful for saturday but hopefully we 'll have sean williams back that shows that the squad is good enough and that we can cope with the injuries . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: share offer this winter to raise funds for railway
text: the severn valley railway says it will be selling shares this winter to help raise funds for a major overhaul of bridgnorth station .
the work is expected to cost around £ 5m and the railway says all the money raised from the share issue will be spent on this project .

svr infrastructure manager chris bond said that since the railway opened in bridgnorth in 1965 a lot of the focus of its efforts had been at the worcestershire end of the line - and it was now time to redress the balance .
we are now returning to bridgnorth to look at what we need to do there to make the bridgnorth end of the railway a more fitting entrance to what we have . ''

documents.title: headlines : a-level results day ; railway plans shares issue ; thunderbirds puppet to be auctioned
text: our top stories this morning include :
- thousands of shropshire a-level students collect their results
- severn valley railway to issue shares to fund station revamp
- original lady penelope puppet to be sold at whitchurch auction
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fire service concern over dry weather that could lead to serious fires
text: firefighters in shropshire are warning of a `` very significant '' risk of fire due to the recent hot weather .
the met office has given the county a fire risk of four out of five .
earlier in the week there was a blaze at a railway embankment at eardington , near bridgnorth .
shropshire fire and rescue service are particularly concerned about cigarette ends and discarded bottles .

documents.title: watch : a-level students in wellington collect their results
text: i 've been at new college in wellington this morning , to see students collect their a-level results .
there are about 1,000 students opening their envelopes today and the college said over 20 courses had produced a 100 % pass rates .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: weather : more cloud around this afternoon
text: it 's going to remain warm in shropshire , but there will be more cloud around this aftermoon .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: bridgnorth station work could start next october
text: a £ 5m scheme to improve bridgnorth 's station on the severn valley railway is likely to be carried out in three phases , with the first phase starting next october .
the railway plans to start by restoring the original bar and waiting rooms , as well as creating a new buffet and toilets - all in the style of gwr buildings from the 1900s .
the second phase will involve the installation of a new turntable for engines and improvements to the car park at the top of the site .
and the final phase of the plans will be the building of a 53-bed accommodation block for volunteers .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather watchers : cloud building over shropshire
text: much cloudier across the county today .
our weather watchers in newport ( top ) and willey ( bottom ) have been out capturing the skies .
if you want to help us paint a of shropshire 's weather , you can sign up here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: original lady penelope puppet to sell at whitchurch auction
text: an original lady penelope puppet from the thunderbirds tv series is going to be sold at auction in whitchurch this saturday .
the model , which was used between 1964 and 1968 is expected to fetch up to £ 20,000 and the auctioneer , christina trevanion , said they 'd already had offers .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: thousands collect a-level results
text: thousands of students across shropshire are up their a-level results this morning .
already several schools and colleges are claiming record pass-rates , despite a slight drop across the uk .
concord college had just over 95 % passing with a-star , a or b grades .
adams grammar in newport had 80 % passing with an a-star , a or b grade .
its head gary hickey said it was a `` privilege to witness pupils you 've worked with since the age of 11 - see all their hard work come to fruition . ''
elsewhere , the maelor at penley is reporting 43 % a or a-star grades .
at the sir john talbot sixth-form in whitchurch , just under two-thirds got at least one a-star , a or b .
head david o'toole said he was `` incredibly proud '' .

documents.title: dalian atkinson : campaigner calls for rigorous investigation
text: a rights activist is calling for a `` rigorous and transparent '' investigation into the death of ex-aston villa footballer dalian atkinson after he was shot with a police taser .
the 48-year-old died after west mercia police shot him with a stun gun in the street where he grew up in telford , shropshire , in the early hours of monday .
a petition calling on the prime minister to urgently review police use of tasers has gathered more than 56,000 signatures .
desmond jaddoo , an activist from birmingham who campaigns to raise awareness about the deaths of black men after police contact , says officers have questions to answer over mr atkinson 's death .
the death of the ex-striker is being investigated by the independent police complaints commission which said it would carry out `` a full and thorough '' inquiry .

documents.title: headlines : a-level results coming in across shropshire ; end of the fa cup for shawbury
text: our top stories this morning :
- several county colleges claim record a-level pass rates
- family of missing man andrew green issue appeal to find him
- shawbury united thrown out of fa cup
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : shawbury out of fa cup
text: shawbury united have been thrown out of the fa cup after their recent replay with coventry united was abandoned with a few minutes to go .
the game had a long delay after an injury to a shawbury player and when it was about to restart , with shawbury losing 1-0 , the floodlights went off .
an fa commission has awarded the game to coventry and told shawbury that a failure to improve what they do could jeopardise playing in the fa cup in the future .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: search continues for missing man
text: the family of a shropshire farmer who disappeared two months ago has issued an appeal to find him .
andrew green , was last seen on 22 june just before 21:00 on his farm in chorley , near bridgnorth .
his car was later found nearby .
his family say his disappearance is out of character and they 've urged anyone with information to contact the police .

documents.title: watch : shropshire veteran gets mobility scooter
text: a shropshire light infantry veteran has been given a mobility scooter by the armed forces charity ssafa .
steve lobb from ellesmere has a degenerative brain condition which has left him unable to walk and his wife contacted the charity for help .
author: Les Walton
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : family of missing farmer issue appeal ; a-level results day for county students
text: here are the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- the family of a farmer who disappeared two months ago has launched appeal to find him
- army veteran given a mobility scooter by the armed forces charity ssafa
- thousands of shropshire students to get a-level results today
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cloudier than yesterday but still warm
text: much cloudier than recent days , but feeling warm with some sunny spells .
alex has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : moving well across shropshire
text: no major problems on the roads so far this morning .
you might find delays on the a49 in hadnall .
temporary traffic lights are in place for water main work at station road .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning - latest updates from bbc shropshire local live
text: i 'm in the bbc shropshire newsroom bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 've got a story or you want to share you can email us or get in touch via facebook and twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: do you know your ash from your oak ?
text: do you know your ash from your oak ?

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : another warm and sunny evening
text: we 're in for another warm and sunny evening in shropshire , with some light cloud appearing late-on .
the forecast for the friday and saturday is n't looking good though .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shrewsbury school at edinburgh fringe
text: among the thousands of acts at this summer 's edinburgh fringe festival are a group from shrewsbury school .
they 're putting on a performance of great expectations and say while it 's not sold out , it is proving popular .

documents.title: police investigate after van blaze spreads to car
text: police are investigating after an early-hours van fire spread to a neighbouring car and fence .
author: Newport Advertiser

documents.title: photos : sea king helicopters on the move
text: four sea king helicopters have been moved from one side of raf cosford to the other - not an easy task , because of their size .
staff at the base had to remove fence panels and move them across roads , while avoiding things like trees and lamp posts .
the aircraft are now in a hangar used to teach trainee engineers about avionics .

documents.title: corbyn rally called off because of 'diary clash '
text: we had been expecting jeremy corbyn to attend a rally in oakengates today - as part of his campaign to win over voters in the labour leadership election .
but that appearance was called off without explanation on friday .

it 's been suggested by his supporters in telford that it was a clash of schedules and this morning he took part in leadership debate with his rival owen smith on the bbc 's victoria derbyshire programme .

documents.title: surfacing work delays m54 opening
text: the delays on the m54 today started at rush hour this morning and at one stage queuing traffic stretched back as far as telford .
the road only fully reopened in the last hour .
the highways agency has explained that it took so long because the a5 between wellington and shrewsbury had to be resurfaced after damage caused by a three-car crash and a separate lorry fire .

documents.title: 'bank of mum and dad ' taken to new level
text: 'bank of mum and dad ' taken to new level

documents.title: headlines : m54 reopens ; music festival cancelled ; barracks plans on show
text: our top stories this evening :
- m54 reopens after accident which caused long delays
- shrewsbury fields forever music festival is cancelled
- plans for copthorne barracks site go on show
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather watchers : some hazy cloud around today
text: it 's been another warm day across shropshire and most of the county has seen blue skies , but around ludlow it seems to be getting a bit hazy this afternoon .
these photos were taken in ludlow ( top ) and norton in hales ( bottom ) by our bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: mod says copthorne demolition will make site more valuable
text: the ministry of defence says that clearing the copthorne barracks site will make it more attractive to developers - so it can sell for a higher price and make more money for the taxpayer .
the mod has agreed to leave the central building , known as caldwell keep , but points out that while most of the buildings are victorian , they are n't listed .
the mod aims to produce a planning application for the redevelopment of the site next month and to have the barracks sold by next summer .

documents.title: the immigration challenge facing stuart
text: the immigration challenge facing stuart
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: festival cancelled after firm folds
text: festival cancelled after firm folds

documents.title: travel : a5 reopens after earlier accident
text: the a5 is fully open again after an accident this morning which brought disruption to a large part of the m54 .
earlier , queues of traffic stretched back as far as junction five for telford .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: hundreds of creditors for festival , including ticket-holders
text: the number of creditors for the shrewsbury fields forever music festival numbers is in the hundreds , according to the insolvency firm brought in to wind up the company organising the event .
irwin insolvency said this number includes all those who bought tickets .
if you have a ticket or are owed money , the number to call for the insolvency firm is 0121 321 1700 or you contact them via email .

documents.title: copthorne plans include 229 homes
text: the planned redevelopment of copthorne barracks site in shrewsbury could include the creation of 229 homes .
the ministry of defence , which is putting the site up for sale , is also suggesting there could be a retirement home there .
the mod plans are on display at shrewsbury town 's stadium today and they also include the conversion of the old parade ground into a landscaped square .

documents.title: headlines : music festival cancelled ; long delays on m54 ; barracks plans on show
text: our top stories this evening include :
- shrewsbury fields forever music festival is cancelled
- long delays on m54 after crash this morning
- plans for copthorne barracks on display
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : long delays remain on m54 westbound
text: long delays remain on the m54 westbound , between junction six for lawley and seven for wellington .
they 've been caused by an accident this morning in which eight people were hurt .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : olympic rider visits shrewsbury nursery children
text: the shropshire based show jumper carlos parro has been visiting children at the prepatoria nursery in shrewsbury this morning .
he was part of the brazilian team which came seventh in the eventing team jumping event .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: council decision to block music festival blamed on lack of information
text: the organisers of the shrewsbury fields forever music festival say they decided to cancel the event because shrewsbury town council refused them permission to hold it in the quarry .
but , shrewsbury town council says it had no choice , blaming a lack of information from the organisers and a failure to meet the council 's set of values .
the council said it had worked hard to allow the rescheduled festival to take place and made the decision with `` great reluctance '' .
it was originally scheduled for 15-17 july and postponed late in the day .

documents.title: shrewbury music festival cancelled and company will cease trading
text: the shrewsbury fields forever music festival has been cancelled and the company running will cease trading , organisers have announced .
it comes after shrewsbury town council refused permission to hold the event in the quarry next month saying it could not be assured of `` good event planning '' .

dene edwards , the director of forever invasion ltd , said that because an insolvency company has been brought in , people with tickets will have to make a claim through their debit or credit cards if they want a refund .

documents.title: football : hart considers loan move
text: shrewsbury 's joe hart is considering a loan move away from manchester city after being dropped for the first two games under pep guardiola .

everton and la liga side sevilla are interested in signing hart , but the 29-year-old england keeper does n't want to make a decision on a permanent move with just two weeks left of the transfer window .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: calls for barracks buildings to be protected
text: the planned demolition of all but the central building at copthorne barracks is upsetting some people - including the local councillor , peter nutting , who wants more of the buildings protected .

the mod would be within its rights to knock everything down , because the site is n't within a conservation area and the buildings are n't listed , but after conversations with shropshire council , it has agreed to leave the building known as caldwell keep - which will form a centre-piece of any new development there .
while shropshire council only has the power to approve the way in which the demolition is carried out , officers have also said they would like to see more structures on the site retained .

documents.title: more tickets available for flying scotsman visit
text: a `` very limited '' number of extra tickets are available today for the visit of the flying scotsman to the severn valley railway .

the heritage line says due to the reallocation of some pre-booked seats on selected trains , a very limited number of tickets have become available to travel for the visit of the locomotive from 21 - 26 september .

documents.title: police investigate vehicle fires in newport
text: police are investigating after two vehicles were set on fire in newport during the early hours of today .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: ten people hurt in m54 crashes
text: eight people have been injured in the three-vehicle accident which has closed a large part of the m54 today .
one man , who is in his 70s , flown to hospital with a head injury and two people had to be cut free from their cars by the fire service .
three children were among those involved , but none were seriously hurt .
earlier , two motorcyclists were injured on the m54 heading east between junctions three and two .
one was treated for back and chest pain , while the other suffered and arm injury and both were taken to hospital .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: latest : large part of m54 closed ; barracks demolition plans ; svr station to expand
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this lunchtime :
- long delays as part of m54 closed westbound
- plans to demolish large parts of copthorne barracks in shrewsbury go on show
- severn valley railway gets permission to redevelop bridgnorth station
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : telford claim first win of season
text: afc telford united have won their first game of the season , beating stalybridge 2-0 at the bucks head .
tom peers put them ahead on the hour-mark and dave hibbert added a second late-on .
the telford manager rob smith said afterwards that hibbert had been their best player of the season and revealed he had been getting frustrated by his lack of goals .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: severn valley railway gets permission for bridgnorth expansion
text: severn valley railway has got planning permission for a multimillion-pound expansion at bridgnorth .
the station building will be expanded , creating a cafe , a larger pub and improved toilet facilities .
the plans , which have been in the pipeline for more than three years , also include a 53-bed hostel for volunteers who work at the heritage railway .

documents.title: football : mellon highlights individual errors after defeat
text: shrewsbury town manager micky mellon says his side gave away goals through individual errors in their 3-0 defeat last night .
the side have failed to score in their three league games this season , but mellon said it was too early in the season to worry about that and said the players were creating chances .
shrewsbury have played milton keynes , coventry and charlton this season , three teams mellon manager believes will be finishing near the top of the table .
i 've seen enough to say if we cut out individua errors , we can give ourselves a chance . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel : delays continue on m54
text: there are long delays on the m54 heading west towards shrewsbury and queuing traffic stretches back past junction five for telford now .
vehicles are being taken on a 33-mile ( 53km ) diversion past randlay and hodnet , rejoining the a49 at battlefield , north of shrewsbury .
meanwhile , delays caused by an accident on the m54 between junction three for albrighton and two for wolverhampton have cleared up .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: west midlands sees biggest jobless increase in uk
text: the west midlands was one of only two regions in the uk to see unemployment rise between april and june , official figures indicate .
across the uk the total fell by 52,000 to 1.64 million - in the west midlands it increased by 18,000 to 173,000 compared with january to march .
the only other region to see unemployment rise was london where it rose by 7,000 people .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: any patchy mist will clear leading to another dry and fine day .
a light south easterly breeze .
temperatures about 25c ( 77f ) .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: brazilian show jumper returns to shropshire from olym
text: the shropshire-based horse rider carlos parro , is back in the county , after competing for brazil at the rio olym last week .
parro helped his home country brazil to seventh place in the eventing team jumping final .
today , he 's hosting an event for children at a shrewsbury nursery in battlefield .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: in villa fans pay tribute to dalian atkinson
text: last night aston villa fans paid tribute to the club 's former striker dalian atkinson , who died after being shot with a taser by police in telford .
supporters took to their feet when a minute 's applause was held 10 minutes into the game against huddersfield town .
see more photos on bbc news .

documents.title: travel : a5 closed
text: the a5 is closed westbounds from the m54 j7 near wellington as far as the preston island .
it 's due to a crash on the approach to the preston island on outskirts of shrewsbury , not helped by the earlier lorry fire and fuel spill nearer wellington .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: barracks plans go on show
text: plans for the redevelopment of copthorne barracks in shrewsbury are to go on show this afternoon .
most of the site 's been empty , apart from a section used by the reservists , since last year and there are proposals to build homes there .
those go on show at shrewsbury town 's stadium this afternoon .
the tower on copthorne road will remain , but the rest will be pulled down imminently .
peter nutting , councillor for the copthorne ward , has called for some of the buildings and open spaces to protected .

documents.title: good morning
text: apologies for the lack of updates so far this morning , we 've been experiencing technical problems behind the scenes .
we 're back up and running now though and we 'll help you catch up on the morning 's news , sport , travel and weather .
